Class LevelGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • LevelGenerator

  • public class LevelGenerator
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LevelGenerator()
      Constructor creates a border of wall tiles around an empty floor plan.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void bisectLargerVerticalAreas()
      This method is called to get rid of abnormally large spaces that occur when a few calls to carveColFrom* and carveRowFrom* end up ignoring the a similar portion of the graph, so we end up with a massive room that typically spans the entire width of the floorPlan.
      void breakFullCols()
      This method is used to carve doorways into columns that didn't end up being chosen to have exits carved into them by any of their adjacent rooms/halls.
      void carveColFromBottom(int col)
      This method carves a wall from the bottom of the graph Everytime we carve past a horizonatl wall, we decrease the number of rowPasses (which are randomly determined).
      void carveColFromTop(int col)
      This method carves a wall from the top of the graph Everytime we carve past a horizontal wall, we decrease the number of rowPasses (which are randomly determined).
      void carveMap()
      This method is called to carve the walls into the floor plan and call the utility functions that clean up some situations that are prohibited by the rules.
      void carveRowFromLeft(int row)
      This method carves a wall from the left side of the graph Everytime we carve past a vertical wall, we decrease the number of colPasses (which are randomly determined).
      void carveRowFromRight(int row)
      This method carves a wall from the right side of the graph Everytime we carve past a vertical wall, we decrease the number of colPasses (which are randomly determined).
      void clearBoxedAreas()
      This method is used after the walls are carved into the floorPlan to fix a periodic occurrance of small 3*3 spaces.
      void clearHorizontalParallelHalls()
      This method is called to clear the same issue as the method above, but deals with horizontal hallways instead of vertical ones.
      void clearVerticalParallelHalls()
      This is a method called after the walls are carved into the floorPlan.
      int[][] getGraph() 
      int getPlayerStartCol() 
      int getPlayerStartRow() 
      void initializeDoorways()
      This method is used to carve doorways into the floorPlan.
      void initializeExit()
      This method is used to initialize the exit on the border of the floorPlan it also sets the tiles adjacent to he exit equal to FLOOR in case a wall was carved right next to the border
      void initializeFireTraps()
      This method is called to randomly place firetraps across the floor plan.
      void initializeObstacles()
      This method is used to randomly place obstacles across the floorPlan
      void initializeStart()
      This method is used to initialize the starting position of the player.
      boolean isBadWall(int wall, int startRow, int startCol, int endRow, int endCol)
      This class is used by initializeDoorways() in order to see if adding an exit to a particular room's wall is a bad idea.
      boolean isColFull(int col)
      This method is called by breakFullCols to see if a given column is completely carved into a wall.
      boolean isFilled()
      This method is used when we're adding exits to every room and hallway.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LevelGenerator

        public LevelGenerator()
        Constructor creates a border of wall tiles around an empty floor plan.

    • Method Detail

      • getPlayerStartRow

        public int getPlayerStartRow()

      • getPlayerStartCol

        public int getPlayerStartCol()

      • getGraph

        public int[][] getGraph()

      • printFloorPlan

        public void printFloorPlan()

      • carveRowFromLeft

        public void carveRowFromLeft(int row)
        This method carves a wall from the left side of the graph Everytime we carve past a vertical wall, we decrease the number of colPasses (which are randomly determined). When colPasses is equal to zero, we stop carving from this row.
        Parameters:
        row - The row from which we will carve across the floor plan

      • carveRowFromRight

        public void carveRowFromRight(int row)
        This method carves a wall from the right side of the graph Everytime we carve past a vertical wall, we decrease the number of colPasses (which are randomly determined). When colPasses is equal to zero, we stop carving from this row.
        Parameters:
        row - The row from which we will carve across the floor plan

      • carveColFromTop

        public void carveColFromTop(int col)
        This method carves a wall from the top of the graph Everytime we carve past a horizontal wall, we decrease the number of rowPasses (which are randomly determined). When rowPasses is equal to zero, we stop carving from this row.
        Parameters:
        col - The col from which we will carve across the floor plan

      • carveColFromBottom

        public void carveColFromBottom(int col)
        This method carves a wall from the bottom of the graph Everytime we carve past a horizonatl wall, we decrease the number of rowPasses (which are randomly determined). When rowPasses is equal to zero, we stop carving from this row.
        Parameters:
        col - The row from which we will carve across the floor plan

      • isInHallway

        public boolean isInHallway(int row,
                           int col)
        This method is called by several methods in this class, as well as some of the methods in GameState. It returns a boolean if the tile in graph[row][col] is located within a hallway or not.
        Parameters:
        row - The row corresponding to the tile in question
        col - The col corresponding to the tile in question
        Returns:
        true if the tile is located in a hallway, false otherwise

      • clearBoxedAreas

        public void clearBoxedAreas()
        This method is used after the walls are carved into the floorPlan to fix a periodic occurrance of small 3*3 spaces. They are neither hallways nor rooms so they need to be cleared.

      • clearVerticalParallelHalls

        public void clearVerticalParallelHalls()
        This is a method called after the walls are carved into the floorPlan. It fixes an issue where occasionally we end up with three hallways sitting atop one another, because java's random number generator sometimes pulls the same number three times in a row.

      • clearHorizontalParallelHalls

        public void clearHorizontalParallelHalls()
        This method is called to clear the same issue as the method above, but deals with horizontal hallways instead of vertical ones.

      • bisectLargerVerticalAreas

        public void bisectLargerVerticalAreas()
        This method is called to get rid of abnormally large spaces that occur when a few calls to carveColFrom* and carveRowFrom* end up ignoring the a similar portion of the graph, so we end up with a massive room that typically spans the entire width of the floorPlan.

      • isFilled

        public boolean isFilled()
        This method is used when we're adding exits to every room and hallway. When we add an exit to a room, we set all of the tiles in that room equal to a number other than ZombieConstants.FLOOR so we don't come back and add more exits. When all of the spaces have exits, we set all of the Floor tiles back to ZombieConstants.FLOOR When this method returns true, every room and hallway has at least one exit carved into it

      • isBadWall

        public boolean isBadWall(int wall,
                         int startRow,
                         int startCol,
                         int endRow,
                         int endCol)
        This class is used by initializeDoorways() in order to see if adding an exit to a particular room's wall is a bad idea. For example, we wouldn't want to have exits being carved into the outside walls by the rooms that border them.

      • initializeDoorways

        public void initializeDoorways()
        This method is used to carve doorways into the floorPlan. Once a room has doorways, we set all of the floor tiles equal to an arbitrary number,3. Once all of the floor tiles equal three we know every room has doorways carved into it

      • initializeExit

        public void initializeExit()
        This method is used to initialize the exit on the border of the floorPlan it also sets the tiles adjacent to he exit equal to FLOOR in case a wall was carved right next to the border

      • initializeStart

        public void initializeStart()
        This method is used to initialize the starting position of the player. It needs to be an appropriate distance away from the exit

      • isColFull

        public boolean isColFull(int col)
        This method is called by breakFullCols to see if a given column is completely carved into a wall.
        Parameters:
        col - Column in question

      • breakFullCols

        public void breakFullCols()
        This method is used to carve doorways into columns that didn't end up being chosen to have exits carved into them by any of their adjacent rooms/halls.

      • initializeObstacles

        public void initializeObstacles()
        This method is used to randomly place obstacles across the floorPlan

      • initializeFireTraps

        public void initializeFireTraps()
        This method is called to randomly place firetraps across the floor plan. They are never placed in hallways

      • carveMap

        public void carveMap()
        This method is called to carve the walls into the floor plan and call the utility functions that clean up some situations that are prohibited by the rules.
